question: Hey, did you hear about the superhero who protects people's online accounts with their secret power?
Oh, you mean Strong Passwords, right? They're like a digital shield against hackers and identity thieves!
What do you get when you combine upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and special characters in a secret code?
That's a strong password! It's like a magical spell that keeps our online accounts safe from cyber villains.
If your password was an impenetrable fortress, what would be the building blocks to make it super secure?
You'd need a mix of letters, numbers, and symbols, along with a good length to create a strong password that can withstand any cyber attack!
What do you call the invisible barrier that helps protect your personal info from prying eyes on the internet?
That's Privacy Settings! They're like a digital invisibility cloak that keeps our personal data safe on social media and other online platforms.
If there was a superhero who could control what others can see about them online, what would their power be called?
Haha, that's Privacy Settings! They let us choose who gets to see our posts, photos, and personal information on the web.
Imagine you had a secret lever that could control how much of your life is visible to others on the internet.
Oh, you mean Privacy Settings! They help us manage our online presence and keep our personal information secure.
I heard Sarah's getting mean comments on her latest video. Some people are just so rude! 🙄
Yeah, that's cyberbullying. Let's show Sarah some love and positivity! 💕 Kindness goes a long way.
You won't believe what happened in the group chat! Everyone ganged up on Jake for his new haircut. 🤦‍♂️
Whoa, hold on! ✋ That's cyberbullying. We should stand up for Jake and remind everyone to be kind and respectful.
I found this super cool website with free movies, but my browser warned me it's not secure. Should I go for it? 🎬
Nah, better safe than sorry! 🚫 Stick to secure sites with "https://" in the URL to protect your data from hackers.
I'm at the coffee shop, and they have free Wi-Fi! Time to check my bank account balance. 💰
Hold up, buddy! ☕ Public Wi-Fi can be risky. Wait until you're on a secure network before accessing sensitive info.
My computer is so slow! 💻 I just downloaded a cool app that promises to speed things up, but now I'm getting weird pop-ups.
Yikes! 😱 Sounds like you got some malware. Always download apps from trusted sources, and use antivirus software for secure browsing.
I just got a message from my bank asking for my account number and PIN. They say it's for "security reasons." Should I reply? 🏦
No way! Banks never ask for that info through messages. It's a scam! Be cautious about sharing personal info to prevent identity theft. 🚫
My password for everything is "password123." Easy to remember, right? 😜
I got an email from a long-lost relative in another country, and they want to send me money! All I have to do is give them my Social Security number. 💸
Hold on! 🛑 That sounds like a scam. Never share your SSN or other sensitive info online. Keep your identity safe!
I just posted my entire vacation itinerary on social media. Now all my friends know where I'll be! 🏖️
That might not be the best idea. 😅 Oversharing can be risky. Keep your personal info and plans private to stay safe on social media.
Hey, I got a friend request from someone super popular, but I don't really know them. Should I accept it? 🤔
Be cautious! Only accept requests from people you actually know. Strangers could have bad intentions. Safety first! 👍
My profile pic is a selfie with my driver's license. It's such a cool shot! 📸
Uh-oh! 🚨 You're sharing sensitive info that can be misused. Choose a fun pic without revealing personal details for better social media safety.
There's this super nice person I met online. They want to meet up in person and even offered to pick me up! 🚗
Hold up! 🚫 You never know who's behind the screen. Stay safe from online predators by only meeting people you know and trust.
I've been chatting with this awesome gamer, but they keep asking for personal details about my life. What should I do? 🎮
Be careful! 🛑 Don't share personal info with strangers online. Some people might not be who they say they are. Safety first!
Someone online asked me to send them "special" photos of myself. They said it's just for fun. 📷
No way! ❌ That's a huge red flag. Never share explicit content or personal images. Keep yourself safe from online predators.
I just posted a rant about my teacher on social media. It felt so good to let it all out! 😤
Careful! 🚨 Your digital footprint lasts forever. What you post today might come back to haunt you later. Think before you post!
I'm applying for college soon. Do you think they'll look at my social media profiles? 🎓
Absolutely! 🕵️‍♂️ Colleges, employers, and even future friends might check your digital footprint. Keep it clean and positive!
I want to create a meme page with some edgy humor. But I'm worried it might affect my future. 😅
Good thinking! 🧠 Your digital footprint sticks around. Consider the long-term consequences of your online actions.
I found this hilarious comic online! I'm gonna post it on my blog without giving credit. No big deal, right? 😂
Actually, that's a copyright issue! 🚫 Always give proper credit to the creator. It's the right thing to do and keeps you out of trouble.
I have an essay due tomorrow, and I haven't started. I'm just gonna copy and paste some stuff from the internet. 📝
Whoa, hold up! ✋ That's plagiarism. You could get in serious trouble. Do your own work or ask for help if you need it.
I love this artist's work so much that I want to print their design on t-shirts and sell them. Easy money, right? 💰
Not so fast! 🛑 That's a copyright violation. If you want to use someone's work, get their permission first.
I found this amazing deal on a sketchy-looking website! I'm gonna buy those sneakers for half the price! 🛍️
Wait a minute! 🚫 Stick to trusted websites for online shopping. Keep your payment info safe and avoid scams.
This online store is asking me to save my credit card info for future purchases. Should I do it? 💳
Be cautious! 🔒 Only save your payment info on secure, reputable sites. And remember, it's always good to double-check before you save.
I just got an email with a coupon code for my favorite store, but the link looks weird. I don't wanna miss out on a deal! 🏷️
Don't risk it! 🚨 If something seems off, go directly to the store's website instead. Safe online shopping is more important than a potential discount.
My email account got hacked! 😱 How can I prevent this from happening again?
Bummer! 😕 Set up two-factor authentication (2FA) for an extra layer of security. It's like having a secret handshake with your account! 🤝
I keep forgetting my passwords, but I heard about this 2FA thing. What's the deal? 🧐
Ugh, two-factor authentication seems so annoying. Do I really need it? 🙄
Trust me, it's worth it! 🛡️ Think of 2FA as a superhero protecting your accounts from evil hackers. Better safe than sorry!
I'm at the library, and they have free Wi-Fi! Time to do some online shopping. 🛒
Hold your horses! 🐴 Public Wi-Fi can be risky for sensitive tasks. Wait until you're on a secure network before entering payment info.
This coffee shop's Wi-Fi is great for browsing memes, but should I check my bank account too? 💸
Nah, keep it chill! ☕ Use public Wi-Fi for casual browsing, not for accessing personal or financial info. Save that for a secure connection at home.
The airport has free Wi-Fi, so I'm gonna catch up on work emails. Good idea? ✈️
Proceed with caution! 🚧 Public Wi-Fi can be a playground for hackers. Use a VPN to encrypt your data and stay safe while working on the go.
My crush asked me to send them a "special" selfie. It's just between us, so it should be fine, right? 🤳
Don't risk it! 🚫 Once you send something, you lose control over it. Keep personal and intimate content to yourself for safety and peace of mind.
options: Sexting and Sharing Personal Information (correct answer)

question: I met this cool person online, but they keep asking for my address so they can send me a gift. Should I share it? 🎁
No way! 🛑 Keep your personal info private, even if someone seems friendly. You never know who's behind the screen or what their intentions are.
options: Sexting and Sharing Personal Information (correct answer)

question: My friend wants me to share my password with them, just in case they need to log in for me. Is that okay? 🔑
Bad idea! 😬 Keep your passwords secret, even from friends. Sharing personal info like that can lead to all sorts of trouble.
options: Sexting and Sharing Personal Information (correct answer)

question: I just joined an online gaming community, and everyone's asking for my real name and where I live. Should I share it? 🎮
Nope! 🚫 Keep your personal info on a need-to-know basis. Use a cool gamer tag instead and stay anonymous to protect yourself.
My gaming buddy offered to level up my character if I give them my account login info. Sounds like a sweet deal, right? 🏆
Hold up! 🛑 Sharing your login details can lead to trouble. Keep your account secure and enjoy the game at your own pace.
I'm playing this awesome game, but some players are being super toxic and harassing me. What should I do? 😓
Don't let them ruin your fun! 🎉 Mute, block, or report them to keep your gaming experience safe and enjoyable.
